metadata.title: CVE-2020-15719 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: libldap in certain third-party OpenLDAP packages has acertificate-validation flaw when the third-party package is assertingRFC6125 support. It considers CN even when there is a non-matchingsubjectAltName (SAN). This is fixed in, for example, openldap-2.4.46-10.el8in Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

criterions.comment: openldap: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
